title: External Payment Processor Integration
context: Payments team requests integration with Stripe for credit card processing to expand payment options beyond current cryptocurrency and bank transfer methods. This would involve external API calls and PCI DSS compliance requirements.
decision: CONDITIONALLY APPROVED - Integration approved subject to meeting specific security, performance, and architectural requirements.

conditions.requirement: Implement circuit breaker pattern for all Stripe API calls
conditions.rationale: Ensure system resilience if external payment processor fails

conditions.requirement: Deploy payment processing at edge using Cloudflare Workers
conditions.rationale: Maintain edge-native architecture and minimize latency

conditions.requirement: Complete PCI DSS Level 1 compliance certification
Implement comprehensive audit logging for all payment transactions
Achieve <200ms P95 latency for payment processing

implementation.timeline: Q4 2025 - 6 weeks development, 2 weeks testing, 2 weeks compliance validation
phases: Phase 1: Security architecture and PCI compliance planning
Phase 3: Circuit breaker and resilience patterns
Phase 4: Comprehensive testing and compliance validation

playbookAlignment.notes: Good alignment when conditions are met. External dependency requires careful resilience planning.

factors: Potential latency impact from external API calls
Security risks from handling credit card data
mitigations: Comprehensive security audit and penetration testing

successCriteria: PCI DSS Level 1 compliance certification achieved
Zero security incidents related to payment processing
Successful processing of 10,000+ transactions during peak load testing
reviewCriteria: All conditions must be met and validated before full production deployment
